title: A History of the Plastic Straw - 4ocean
body: A History of the Plastic Straw. January 23, 2019. The straw is quite possibly one of the oldest utensils mankind ever invented. As early as 3000 B.C., some elaborate, archeological examples date to the ancient Sumerians who used straws made of gold to drink their beer and native Argentinians who used carved wood straws to both drink and filter ...
readable_content:
4ocean Public Benefit Corp. (2023-12-08): A History of the Plastic Straw

The straw has a long history, with evidence of usage dating back to 3000 B.C. Early examples include straws made of gold and carved wood. Marvin C. Stone patented the paper straw in 1888, and plastic straw designs emerged in the 1960s. However, plastic straws have resulted in environmental issues, leading to bans in various places.

We at 4ocean recognize the need to address the larger problem of ocean plastic pollution. Our Ocean Plastic Recovery campaign aims to remove millions of pounds of plastic from the ocean. We encourage individuals to share their thoughts on plastic straw bans and consider contributing to our cause.

By purchasing a 4ocean bracelet, individuals can remove a pound of plastic and trash from the ocean and coastlines, thereby contributing to the initiative to combat ocean plastic pollution.

End of blog post
